AOd.caption: left-meeting
AOd.doc: Emitted once the local participant has joined the call. At this point, the call is considered connected.
AOd.name: left-meeting

AOi.caption: joined-meeting
AOi.doc: Emitted once the local participant has left the call. From the local user's perspective, this means the call has disconnected.
AOi.name: joined-meeting

ANu.caption: This video call element includes the ability to customize theme colors for various parts of the video call UI. You can choose to leave these colors as is or customize the values below.
ANu.name: color_theme

ANv.caption: accent
ANv.doc: Main theme color. Used for primary actions and keyboard focus.
ANv.name: accent

ANz.caption: baseText
ANz.doc: Default text and icon color, as rendered on background or backgroundAccent.
ANz.name: basetext

AOA.caption: border
AOA.doc: Default border color for bordered elements.
AOA.name: border

AOB.caption: mainAreaBG
AOB.doc: Background color for the main call area.
AOB.name: mainAreaBg

AOD.caption: mainAreaText
AOD.doc: Text color for text rendered inside the call main area, e.g. names.
AOD.name: mainareatext

AOE.caption: supportiveText
AOE.doc: Text color for supportive, less emphasized, text.
AOE.name: supportivetext

AOG.caption: To learn more about color theming, visit https://docs.daily.co/guides/customizing-daily-prebuilt-calls-with-color-themes
AOG.name: colorlink

AOz.caption: active speaker mode
AOz.doc: Specifies whether to start the Daily Prebuilt call in active speaker mode. Defaults to yes, but can be set to no to start the call in grid mode instead.
AOz.name: active_speaker_mode

ARB.caption: :  ðŸš¨ Important Notice: This element is not compatible with the current responsive engine and will be removed by December 2024. Please transition to the custom method outlined below to ensure continued functionality. The updated method replaces this element by utilizing the Daily - join room action.
ARB.name: info_1

ARC.caption: To create custom-sized video calls using Bubble's updated responsive engine, follow these steps:
ARC.name: info_2

ARD.caption: 1. In Bubble's settings, make sure to check "expose the option to add an ID attribute to HTML elements" under the General appearance section in the General tab.
ARD.name: info_3

ARE.caption: 2.  Create a group within Bubble where your video call will overlay, and add a name to the ID attribute section of the group.
ARE.name: info_4

ARF.caption: 3. In your workflow, use the "Daily - Join Room" action.
ARF.name: info_5

ARG.caption: 4. Select "custom" for the "room style," and in the "Custom position options" field, enter the same ID attribute used for the group in the "element ID" section. Your video call will overlay over the group you created.
ARG.name: info_6
